_comment: Created by hdorning on 23/08/2017 15:38:37 using v2.7
title: What's happening to people waiting the longest for treatment (over 52 weeks)?
analysis_commentary:
The proportion of patients with an incomplete pathway waiting over 52 weeks has been falling steadily and has been below 0.3% since November 2011. Although the proportion has fallen, the number of people has increased in the past two years, from 634 in May 2015 to 1,651 in May 2017.

Updated July 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
